name: "Information" - book by Rex Ray
description: The 480 page, hardcover book documents Ray’s life and career. "Information" is a visual journey of Rex's inspirations. The book contains images of his artwork, photographs taken by the artist, private moments of inspiration and personal images of the artist's childhood. “Information” is a collection of moments that have shaped the artist and his work.

name: How To Make a Rex Ray - DVD
description:
Featuring Rex Ray and Skeeter
Directors: Joshua V. Hassel
Format: NTSC
Region 1 (U.S. and Canada only)
Studio: Colorado Public Television
DVD Release Date: March 1, 2010
Run Time: 57 minutes

Join Rex on a tour of his hometown Colorado Springs then on to his colorful live/work studio space in San Francisco as he reveals his artistic process and everyday practice. 

Amazon reviews said of this DVD: "Not since 'The Mystery of Picasso' has a documentary captured the grace and handiwork of an artist as casual and sophisticated as Rex Ray. He is the most intriguing combination of humble and virtuosic, not skirting the line between fine art and painting but showing the beauty and power of living right on it."

DVD extras include extended Rex Ray interview and art loops. 

Cost includes shipping via US Post Media Mail within the Continental U.S. write us for shipping cost to other locations
